results.title: Kyneton: queen of the uplands
results.brief_description: Promotional film about Kyneton, Victoria, the ‘Cinderella of Victoria’s summer resorts’. Scenes include: the railway; civic buildings; a hotel; shops; churches; the racecourse; botanical gardens; a golf course; a high school and shots of the town taken from the balcony of Rock House. Local points of interest shown include: views from Rockview Ridge and Ennis Hill; Panorama Rocks; Mitchell’s, Quigg’s and Turpin’s Falls; Lincoln Knitting Mills; mineral springs; Metcalf Cascades; the Campaspe and Coliban Rivers; Coliban Reservoir at Tylden and the homestead of Gerald Buckley’s horse stud. Kyneton Agricultural Show is featured.

results.title: Water against wildfire
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson, Kestrel Films (Australia) and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film was made at the request of Victoria’s Forest Commission. Bush fires all over Australia and indeed all parts of the world create havoc not only on the environment of humans but also on the delicate balance of the natural world. A training film directed towards forest workers on how to use water on forest fires and the follow-up after the fire has been contained.

results.title: Community College Mt Gambier: growing
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, New Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the story of the South East Community College Mount Gambier. Features two teachers, Bev Puckridge and Ian Winter, who narrate throughout the film. Shows how students go back to their own communities and set up and teach smaller groups in woodwork, pottery, spinning etc. Emphasis is made that art is a natural part of our world - a natural thing to do. It is not the finished product that really matters, but the thought process used to achieve it.

results.title: The Coastline
results.creator_credit: Eric Lomas, Victorian Film Corporation and Yarra Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria the Garden State”.
A scenic film which shows the coastline of Victoria, and its wildlife. Without commentary.

results.title: Toronto jazz
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto is regarded as the third largest jazz centre in North America. This film features a cross-section of jazz bands of that city: the Lenny Breau Trio, the Don Thompson Quintet and the Alf Jones Quartet. Their styles show creative self-expression, hard work, and improvisation.

results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.

results.title: Land use and abuse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of careless land development on the Tasmanian environment and goes on to stress the need for conservationists and developers to work together. Narrated by Stewart Faichney.

results.title: In partnership with the people
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Battery Point is one of the oldest parts of Hobart and the City Council is about to put into practice a development plan which will retain the character and charm of this area. Shows the signal station, the seamen’s cottages, the fine houses of the wealthy, Kelly’s Steps, St George’s Church and other historic items.
